column2: officially the Municipality of Pinamungajan (Cebuano: Lungsod sa Pinamungajan; Tagalog: Bayan ng Pinamungajan)
column3: is a 2nd class municipality in the province of Cebu
column6: 955 people.It is bordered to the north by the City of Toledo
column7: to the west is the Tañon Strait
column8: to the east is the city of Naga and the town of San Fernando
column9: and to the south is the town of Aloguinsan.

column3: was established in the 1815 under the Spanish colonial government in the country. The municipality got its name from the diligent and hardworking people
column4: working hand-in-hand especially during the agricultural harvest season – "Pinamungajan"
column5: which originated from the Visayan word pinamuhuan
column6: meant a worker share for his effort during a farm harvest. Over time the Pinamuhuan eventually changed to the current name of the municipality.

column1: The town patroness is Saint Monica
column2: mother of one of the fathers and doctors of the Catholic Church
column5: Pinamungajan celebrates the memorial of the saint on May 4. In 2008
column6: in response to the call of then governor and now Congresswoman Gwendolyn Garcia for each Cebu town and city to hold a festival as part of local culture and heritage
column7: Pinamungajan began the Pinamuohan Festival in honor of Saint Monica on her memorial.
